growing_notes: Biennial/short-lived perennial. Adds 70-150 lbs N/acre. Zones 3-9. Mow or till under before seed set.
Perennial ground cover. Adds 40-110 lbs N/acre. Zones 3-10. Spreads by stolons. Living mulch.
Annual. Adds 70-150 lbs N/acre. Beautiful red flowers. Good for cool season.
Annual/biennial. Adds 100-200 lbs N/acre. Very cold hardy. Plant with cereal rye.
Annual. Adds 80-150 lbs N/acre. Very cold hardy. Tilled under before flowering.
Perennial. Adds 150-250 lbs N/acre. Deep taproot (10+ feet) breaks up compaction. Zones 3-9.
Annual. Adds 80-140 lbs N/acre. Heat and drought tolerant. Suppresses weeds well.
Annual. Adds 100-150 lbs N/acre. Suppresses root-knot nematodes. Fast growing.
Annual grain. Excellent erosion control. Very cold hardy. Allelopathic (suppresses weeds). Scavenges nitrogen.
Annual grain. Winter-kills in zone 6 and colder. Quick biomass. Good nurse crop for legumes.
Annual. Very fast establishment. Erosion control. Scavenges nutrients. Easy to kill.
Annual grain. Plant fall, harvest early summer. Scavenges nitrogen. Good biomass.
Annual grain. Fast growing. Drought tolerant. Good for spring or fall planting.
Annual grain. Heat and drought tolerant. Fast growing. Suppresses weeds.
Annual. Very fast growth. Deep roots break compaction. Allelopathic. Heat/drought tolerant.
Annual. Fast growing. Biofumigant properties suppress soil pests. Scavenges nutrients.
Annual. Taproot penetrates 12-24 inches, breaking compaction. Winter-kills in zone 6. Scavenges deep nitrogen.
Annual/biennial. Quick biomass. Scavenges nutrients. Biofumigant properties.
Annual/biennial. Very cold hardy. Good fall cover. Scavenges nutrients well.
Annual. Very fast growth (35-40 days to flower). Scavenges phosphorus. Excellent pollinator attractant.
Annual. Excellent for beneficial insects. Fast growing. Good biomass. Blue flowers.
